page.title: 14Care of the elderly, P. Wood
page.content: Macdonald Court is an old people's home controlled by two wardens.It was opened on March 17th 1976 by Councillor Lieutenant Colonel R.J.Smith M.B.E. and named after Dr. James Macdonald,a local G.P. It was built to enable some of the elderly people of Paddock Wood to live independently,but with help at hand. There are 28 residents.They go on day trips,then they set off from Dowding House. Dowding House is named after Air Chief Marshal Lord Dowding.All of the 30 residents look after themselves but there is a warden who helps them when in need. Many residents have lived in Paddock Wood for over forty years. Dowding House was opened on April 28th 1978.
